DataElement.preferredName: PET Pixel Value Transformation Sequence DICOM Sequence of Items Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Attributes involved in the transformation of stored pixel values._SQ: Text used to describe named areas of the body as an order set of zero to 'n' values referenced by ordinal position starting with 1 as defined in the 2007 DICOM, Part 5, Paragraph 7.5 Nesting of Data Sets. Size of text may be an Explicit Length or variable Undefined Length.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Attributes involved in the transformation of stored pixel values.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A noninvasive imaging method that provides information about cellular activity (metabolic information).  It is used along with magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) which provides information about the shape and size of the tumor (spatial information).

Concepts.definition: A technique for measuring the gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons (anti-electrons) within living tissue. In positron emission tomography (PET), a subject is given a dose of a positron-emitting radionuclide attached to a metabolically active substance (for example, 2-fluoro-2-deoxy-D-glucose (FDG), which is similar to a naturally occurring sugar, glucose, with the addition of a radioactive fluorine atom). When living tissue containing the positron emitter is bombarded by electrons, gamma radiation produced by collisions of electrons and positrons is detected by a scanner, revealing in fine detail the tissue location of the metabolically-active substance administered.

Property.preferredDefinition: The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory. (Free On-Line Dictionary of Computing):A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.:The conversion of a cell from a normal phenotype, which undergoes a limited number of mitotic divisions, into an aberrant phenotype that is immortal and divides indefinitely. Transformed cells no longer retain cell-cycle checkpoints and may ultimately become malignant cancer cells via additional genetic mutations, or damaging environmental events.:Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

Concepts.definition: The smallest resolvable rectangular area of an image, either on a screen or stored in memory.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

The conversion of a cell from a normal phenotype, which undergoes a limited number of mitotic divisions, into an aberrant phenotype that is immortal and divides indefinitely. Transformed cells no longer retain cell-cycle checkpoints and may ultimately become malignant cancer cells via additional genetic mutations, or damaging environmental events.
A serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/29/10 Released for use in Image SUV Calculation Module.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Sequence; serial arrangement in which things follow in logical order or a recurrent pattern.:A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.:Text; the words of something written.

A group of items of the same type, gathered for display or study.
